title: Supported software titles
content:
This section lists the software titles that SAM supports and describes the license rules that SAM provides out of the box for license consumption calculation.

The OOTB license rules aren't editable. You can reuse them or create new ones if necessary. 

Currently, these license rules can only help calculate license consumption per Host, OSE, and User, but they don't support the software maintenance contracts.

The OOTB license rules that SAM offers include generic license rules and publisher-specific license rules.

 

Different license rules might require different parameters. You need to configure the right discovery jobs to collect required software deployment data from UD/UCMDB.
Generally, if a license rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations on a physical device, the relationships between the virtual machine and its underlying physical infrastructure also need to be discovered. For more information, see the Prerequisites section.

Generic

This table lists the generic license rules:

License metric License rule Rule description
Per installation Generic per installation rule

Calculates license consumption for products licensed by installation.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations and their related OSE (either a physical or virtual OSE).

Each software installation in the OSE consumes one license point. The total number of consumed license points is equal to the number of software installations in the OSE.

Formula:

Total number of consumed license points = count(installations in the OSE)
Per device Generic per device rule

Calculates license consumption for products licensed by physical device.

Prerequisites:

For software that is installed on a virtual machine, the rule requires that the relationship between the virtual machine and the physical server is established in UCMDB. See the UCMDB documentation for details.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations on a physical device. The software products are installed in the physical OSE or the virtual OSEs hosted by that physical device.

The total number of consumed license points is always 1.

Formula:

Total number of consumed license points = 1
Per core Generic rule that calculates consumption based on cores on the host

Calculates license consumption for products under the Per Core licensing model.

The core-based model requires licensing for all physical cores. This means physical cores that support VM running should also be licensed if a product runs on this VM.

Prerequisites:

For software that is installed on a virtual machine, the rule requires that the relationship between the virtual machine and the physical server is established in UCMDB. See the UCMDB documentation for details.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations on a physical device. The software products are installed in the physical OSE or the virtual OSEs hosted by that physical device.

  • Installations exist in the physical OSE
    The total number of consumed license points is equal to the number of physical cores in the OSE.
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    1. Get the number of physical cores on the physical device.
    2. Get the sum of virtual cores in all virtual OSEs.
    3. Use the smaller value as the total number of consumed license points.

Formula:

total number of consumed license points = min(count(physical cores on the device), sum(virtual cores in virtual OSE))
Per OSE Generic rule that calculates consumption based on Operating System Environment (OSE)

Calculates license consumption for products licensed by OSE (either physical OSE or virtual OSE).

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations and their related OSE (either a physical or virtual OSE).

The total number of consumed license points is always 1.

Formula:

Total number of consumed license points = 1
Per user Generic user-based license rule

Calculates license consumption for products licensed by person.

For how to use this rule to create SAM compliance reports, see Create compliance reports for products using user-based license rules.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on the software installations and their related OSEs (either physical or virtual OSEs) owned by a user.

For a given user, the total number of consumed license points is always 1 regardless of how many software installations the user owns.

Formula:

Total number of consumed license points = 1

Publisher-specific (on-premises)

The following section lists the supported on-premises software titles and the corresponding license rules per publisher:

Microsoft

Microsoft products

Product Supported versions Supported editions License rule
SQL Server 2019, 2017, 2016 Enterprise Licensing for 2016 Enterprise Edition, without core factor applied
2019, 2017, 2016 Standard
  • Licensing for 2016 Standard Edition, without core factor applied
  • Licensing for 2012 Standard Edition when the product runs on an OSE
2014, 2012 Enterprise Licensing for 2012 Enterprise Edition, using core factor when the product runs on a physical OSE
2014, 2012 Standard Licensing for 2012 Standard Edition, using core factor when the product runs on a physical OSE
2014, 2012 Business Intelligence Licensing for 2012 Standard Edition when the product runs on an OSE
Windows Server 2022， 2019, 2016 Datacenter Licensing for 2016 Datacenter Edition and higher
2022, 2019, 2016 Standard Licensing for 2016 Standard Edition and higher
2012 R2, 2012 Datacenter Licensing for 2012 Datacenter Edition and higher
2012 R2, 2012 Standard Licensing for 2012 Standard Edition and higher
Office 2021, 2019, 2016, 2013, 2010 Standard, Professional, Professional Plus Licensing for desktop applications
Office Visio 2019, 2016, 2013 Standard, Professional Licensing for desktop applications
2010 Standard, Professional, Premium Licensing for desktop applications
Office Project 2019, 2016, 2013, 2010 Standard, Professional Licensing for desktop applications
Visual Studio 2022, 2019, 2017, 2015 Enterprise, Professional Licensing for desktop applications
2013, 2012, 2010 Professional, Premium, Ultimate Licensing for desktop applications
Exchange Server 2019, 2016, 2013, 2010 Standard, Enterprise Licensing for server software
Office Project Server 2019, 2016, 2013, 2010   Licensing for server software
SharePoint Server 2019, 2016, 2013, 2010   Licensing for server software
Skype for Business Server 2019, 2015   Licensing for server software
Lync Server 2013, 2010   Licensing for server software
BizTalk Server 2020, 2016 Enterprise Licensing for 2016 Enterprise Edition, without core factor applied
2020, 2016 Standard, Branch Licensing for 2016 Standard Edition, without core factor applied
2013 R2, 2013 Enterprise Licensing for 2012 Enterprise Edition, using core factor when the product runs on a physical OSE
2013 R2, 2013 Standard, Branch Licensing for 2012 Standard Edition, using core factor when the product runs on a physical OSE
2010 Enterprise Licensing for 2010 Enterprise Edition, using Per Processor when the product runs on a physical OSE
2010 Standard, Branch Licensing for 2010 Standard Edition, using Per Processor when the product runs on a physical OSE
Windows Desktop OS 11, 10, 8.1, 8 Enterprise, Professional Licensing for desktop operating systems

License rules for Microsoft products

Licensing for 2012 Enterprise Edition, using core factor when the product runs on a physical OSE
License metric Per core
Rule description
  • Calculates license consumption for products of Enterprise Edition under the Per Core licensing model.
  • Uses core factor when the product runs in a physical OSE.

  • Supports 2012 Enterprise Edition and higher.

Prerequisites:

For software that is installed on a virtual machine, the rule requires that the relationship between the virtual machine and the physical server is established in UCMDB. See the UCMDB documentation for details.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations on a physical device. The software products are installed in the physical OSE or the virtual OSEs hosted by that physical device.

This rule calculates license consumption differently for the following scenarios:

  • Installations exist in the physical OSE
    1. Count the total number of physical cores in the physical OSE.
    2. Multiply the number of physical cores by the appropriate core factor to determine the total number of consumed license points. Note that the core factor used depends on the processor type deployed. For more information, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=229882.
    3. Because the core licenses are sold in packs of two, the total number of consumed license points must be rounded and can be divided by two.
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    In this scenario, SAM calculates license consumption for the following two options:
    • Licensing individual virtual machines
      1. Count the total number of virtual cores in all virtual OSEs. A minimum of four core licenses are required for each virtual OSE.
      2. Because the core licenses are sold in packs of two, the total number of consumed license points must be rounded and can be divided by two.
    • Licensing all physical cores on the server
      The calculation logic is the same as that in the "Installations exist in the physical OSE" scenario. Additionally, SAM assumes that the licenses to be used for entitlement are covered by Software Assurance (known as SA). This means that the number of virtual OSEs might be unlimited.
    After license consumption calculation for the preceding two options, SAM compares the results and uses the smaller value as the total number of consumed license points.

Formula:

  • Installations exist in the physical OSE
    total number of consumed license points = round(round(count(physical cores on the device) * core factor) / 2) * 2
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    total number of consumed license points = min(round(round(count(physical cores on the device) * core factor) / 2) * 2, round(sum(max(4, count(virtual cores in virtual OSE))) / 2) * 2)
Licensing for 2012 Standard Edition, using core factor when the product runs on a physical OSE
License metric Per core
Rule description
  • Calculates license consumption for products of Standard Edition under the Per Core licensing model.
  • Uses core factor when the product runs on a physical OSE.

  • Supports 2012 Standard Edition and higher.

Prerequisites:

For software that is installed on a virtual machine, the rule requires that the relationship between the virtual machine and the physical server is established in UCMDB. See the UCMDB documentation for details.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations on a physical device. The software products are installed in the physical OSE or the virtual OSEs hosted by that physical device.

This rule calculates license consumption differently for the following scenarios: 

  • Installations exist in the physical OSE
    1. Count the total number of physical cores in the physical OSE.
    2. Multiply the number of physical cores by the appropriate core factor to determine the total number of consumed license points. Note that the core factor used depends on the processor type deployed. For more information, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=229882.
    3. Because the core licenses are sold in packs of two, the total number of consumed license points must be rounded and can be divided by two.
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    In this scenario, SAM calculates license consumption for the following option: Licensing individual virtual machines
    1. Count the total number of virtual cores in all virtual OSEs. A minimum of four core licenses are required for each virtual OSE.
    2. Because the core licenses are sold in packs of two, the total number of consumed license points must be rounded and can be divided by two.

Formula:

  • Installations exist in the physical OSE
    total number of consumed license points = round(round(count(physical cores on the device) * core factor) / 2) * 2
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    total number of consumed license points = round(sum(max(4, count(virtual cores in virtual OSE))) / 2) * 2
Licensing for 2016 Enterprise Edition, without core factor applied
License metric Per core
Rule description
  • Calculates license consumption for products of Enterprise Edition under the Per Core licensing model.
  • Does not apply core factor when the product runs in a physical OSE.
  • Supports 2016 Enterprise Edition and higher.

Prerequisites:

For software that is installed on a virtual machine, the rule requires that the relationship between the virtual machine and the physical server is established in UCMDB. See the UCMDB documentation for details.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations on a physical device. The software products are installed in the physical OSE or the virtual OSEs hosted by that physical device.

This rule calculates license consumption differently for the following scenarios: 

  • Installations exist in the physical OSE
    1. Count the total number of physical cores in the physical OSE as the total number of consumed license points. A minimum of four core licenses are required for each physical processor on the server.
    2. Because the core licenses are sold in packs of two, the total number of consumed license points must be rounded and can be divided by two.
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    In this scenario, SAM calculates license consumption for the following two options:
    • Licensing individual virtual machines
      1. Count the total number of virtual cores in all virtual OSEs. A minimum of four core licenses are required for each virtual OSE.
      2. Because the core licenses are sold in packs of two, the total number of consumed license points must be rounded and can be divided by two.
    • Licensing all physical cores on the server
      The calculation logic is the same as that in the "Installations exist in the physical OSE" scenario. Additionally, SAM assumes that the licenses to be used for entitlement are covered by Software Assurance (known as SA). This means that the number of virtual OSEs might be unlimited. 
    After license consumption calculation for the preceding two options, SAM compares the results and uses the smaller value as the total number of consumed license points.

Formula:

  • Installations exist in the physical OSE
    total number of consumed license points = max(4 * count(physical processors on the device), round(count(physical cores on the device) / 2) * 2)
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    total number of consumed license points = min(max(4 * count(physical processors on the device), round(count(physical cores on the device) / 2) * 2), round(sum(max(4, count(virtual cores in virtual OSE))) / 2) * 2)
Licensing for 2016 Standard Edition, without core factor applied
License metric Per core
Rule description
  • Calculates license consumption for products of Standard Edition under the Per Core licensing model.
  • Does not apply core factor when the product runs in a physical OSE.
  • Supports 2016 Standard Edition and higher.

Prerequisites:

For software that is installed on a virtual machine, the rule requires that the relationship between the virtual machine and the physical server is established in UCMDB. See the UCMDB documentation for details.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations on a physical device. The software products are installed in the physical OSE or the virtual OSEs hosted by that physical device.

This rule calculates license consumption differently for the following scenarios: 

  • Installations exist in the physical OSE
    1. Count the total number of physical cores in the physical OSE as the total number of consumed license points. A minimum of four core licenses are required for each physical processor on the server.
    2. Because the core licenses are sold in packs of two, the total number of consumed license points must be rounded and can be divided by two.
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    In this scenario, SAM calculates license consumption for the following option: Licensing individual virtual machines
    1. Count the total number of virtual cores in all virtual OSEs. A minimum of four core licenses are required for each virtual OSE.
    2. Because the core licenses are sold in packs of two, the total number of consumed license points must be rounded and can be divided by two.

Formula:

  • Installations exist in the physical OSE
    total number of consumed license points = max(4 * count(physical processors on the device), round(count(physical cores on the device) / 2) * 2)
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    total number of consumed license points = round(sum(max(4, count(virtual cores in virtual OSE))) / 2) * 2
Licensing for 2012 Standard Edition when the product runs on an OSE
License metric Server/CAL
Rule description
  • Calculates license consumption for products of Standard Edition under the Server licensing model.
  • Uses Server CAL when the product runs in an OSE.
  • Supports 2012 Standard Edition and higher.

Prerequisites:

For software that is installed on a virtual machine, the rule requires that the relationship between the virtual machine and the physical server is established in UCMDB. See the UCMDB documentation for details.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations and their related OSE (either a physical or virtual OSE).

The total number of consumed license points is always 1.

Formula:

Total number of consumed license points = 1
Licensing for 2010 Enterprise Edition, using Per Processor when the product runs on a physical OSE
License metric Processor
Rule description
  • Calculates license consumption for products of Enterprise Edition under the Per Processor licensing model.
  • Supports 2010 Enterprise Edition and higher.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations on a physical device. The software products are installed in the physical OSE or the virtual OSEs hosted by that physical device.

This rule calculates license consumption differently for the following scenarios: 

  • Installations exist in the physical OSE
    Count the total number of physical processors in the physical OSE as the total number of consumed license points.
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    In this scenario, SAM calculates license consumption for the following two options:
    • Licensing based on processors used
      1. For each virtual OSE, divide the total number of cores by the number of physical cores on each physical processor to get the number of processors to be licensed.
      2. Get the sum of used processors for all virtual OSEs as the total number of consumed license points. 
    • Unlimited virtualization
      The calculation logic is the same as that in the "Installations exist in the physical OSE" scenario.
    After license consumption calculation for the preceding two options, SAM compares the results and uses the smaller value as the total number of consumed license points.
Formula:
  • Installations exist in the physical OSE
    total number of consumed license points = count(physical processors on the device)
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    total number of consumed license points = min(count(physical processors on the device), sum(round(count(virtual cores in virtual OSE) / cores per physical processor)))
Licensing for 2010 Standard Edition, using Per Processor when the product runs on a physical OSE
License metric Processor
Rule description
  • Calculates license consumption for products of Standard Edition under the Per Processor licensing model.
  • Supports 2010 Standard Edition and higher.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations on a physical device. The software products are installed in the physical OSE or the virtual OSEs hosted by that physical device.

This rule calculates license consumption differently for the following scenarios: 

  • Installations exist in the physical OSE
    Count the total number of physical processors in the physical OSE as the total number of consumed license points.
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    In this scenario, SAM calculates license consumption for the following option: Licensing based on processors used
    1. For each virtual OSE, divide the total number of cores by the number of physical cores on each physical processor to get the number of processors to be licensed.
    2. Get the sum of used processors for all virtual OSEs as the total number of consumed license points.
Formula:
  • Installations exist in the physical OSE
    total number of consumed license points = count(physical processors on the device)
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    total number of consumed license points = sum(round(count(virtual cores in virtual OSE) / cores per physical processor))
Licensing for 2016 Datacenter Edition and higher
License metric Server (OS) - Per Core/CAL
Rule description
  • Calculates license consumption for Microsoft products that fit the core-based metrics of server operating system licenses. 

  • Supports 2016 Datacenter Edition and higher.

Prerequisites:

For software that is installed on a virtual machine, the rule requires that the relationship between the virtual machine and the physical server is established in UCMDB. See the UCMDB documentation for details.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations on a physical device. The software products are installed in the physical OSE or the virtual OSEs hosted by that physical device.

The total number of consumed license points is equal to the number of physical cores on the device. A minimum of eight core licenses are required for each physical processor and a minimum of 16 core licenses are required for each server.

Formula:

Total number of consumed license points = max(16, max(8, cores per physical processor) * count(physical processor on the device))
Licensing for 2016 Standard Edition and higher
License metric Server (OS) - Per Core/CAL
Rule description
  • Calculates license consumption for Microsoft products that fit the core-based metrics of server operating system licenses. 

  • Supports 2016 Standard Edition and higher.

Prerequisites:

For software that is installed on a virtual machine, the rule requires that the relationship between the virtual machine and the physical server is established in UCMDB. See the UCMDB documentation for details.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations on a physical device. The software products are installed in the physical OSE or the virtual OSEs hosted by that physical device.

This rule calculates license consumption differently for the following scenarios: 

  • Installations only exist in the physical OSE
    The total number of consumed license points is equal to the number of physical cores on the device. A minimum of eight core licenses are required for each physical processor and a minimum of 16 core licenses are required for each server.
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    For every two virtual OSEs, the number of consumed license points is the same as the result of the scenario "Installations only exist in the physical OSE".

Formula:

  • Installations only exist in the physical OSE
    total number of consumed license points = max(16, max(8, cores per physical processor) * count(physical processor on the device))
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    total number of consumed license points = round(count(virtual OSEs) / 2) * max(16, max(8, cores per physical processor) * count(physical processor on the device))
Licensing for 2012 Datacenter Edition and higher
License metric Server (OS) - Processor/CAL
Rule description
  • Calculates license consumption for Microsoft products that fit the processor-based metrics of server operating system licenses. 

  • Supports 2012 Datacenter Edition and higher.

Prerequisites:

For software that is installed on a virtual machine, the rule requires that the relationship between the virtual machine and the physical server is established in UCMDB. See the UCMDB documentation for details.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations on a physical device. The software products are installed in the physical OSE or the virtual OSEs hosted by that physical device.

Every two physical processors consume one license point. Then, the total number of consumed license points is equal to the number of physical processors on that device divided by two.

Formula:

Total number of consumed license points = round(count(physical processor on the device) / 2)
Licensing for 2012 Standard Edition and higher
License metric Server (OS) - Processor/CAL
Rule description
  • Calculates license consumption for Microsoft products that fit the processor-based metrics of server operating system licenses. 

  • Supports 2012 Standard Edition and higher.

Prerequisites:

For software that is installed on a virtual machine, the rule requires that the relationship between the virtual machine and the physical server is established in UCMDB. See the UCMDB documentation for details.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations on a physical device. The software products are installed in the physical OSE or the virtual OSEs hosted by that physical device.

This rule calculates license consumption differently for the following scenarios: 

  • Installations only exist in the physical OSE
    Every two physical processors consume one license point. Then, the total number of consumed license points is equal to the number of physical processors on that device divided by two.
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    1. Every two virtual OSEs consume one license point.
    2. Get the sum of consumed license points for all virtual OSEs, compare it with the result in the "Installations only exist in the physical OSE" scenario, and then use the larger value as the total number of consumed license points.

Formula:

  • Installations only exist in the physical OSE
    total number of consumed license points = round(count(physical processor on the device) / 2)
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    total number of consumed license points = max(round(count(physical processor on the device) / 2), round(count(virtual OSEs) / 2))
Licensing for desktop applications
License metric Desktop application - Device License
Rule description

Calculates license consumption for Microsoft products that fit the device-based metrics of desktop application licenses. 

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations and their related OSE (either a physical or virtual OSE).

The total number of consumed license points is always 1.

Formula:

Total number of consumed license points = 1
Licensing for server software
License metric License (per instance) - Server/CAL
Rule description

Calculates license consumption for Microsoft products that fit the Server/CAL metrics of server application licenses.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations and their related OSE (either a physical or virtual OSE).

The total number of consumed license points is always 1.

Formula:

Total number of consumed license points = 1
Licensing for desktop operating systems
License metric Desktop Operating System (per device)
Rule description

Calculates license consumption for the device-based metrics of Microsoft Windows product licenses.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations and their related OSE (either a physical or virtual OSE).

The total number of consumed license points is always 1.

Formula:

Total number of consumed license points = 1

Application-level clusters for Microsoft products

The following table lists out the software titles of Microsoft products that support the application-level clusters:

Product Application-level cluster

SQL Server

SQL Sever cluster
 

The license consumption calculation for application-level clusters is now supported for some products. Both physical and application-level clusters are supported if you enable the Support cluster scenarios option. For details, see Enable license consumption calculation for the cluster scenario.

IBM

ILMT provides data on license consumption per server, based on which SAM summarizes license usage for all servers by using the following license rules:

  • PVU rule for IBM LMT solution
  • RVU rule for IBM LMT solution

License rules for ILMT-managed products

PVU rule for IBM LMT solution
License metric Processor value unit (PVU)
Rule description

Calculate license consumption for ILMT-managed products based on the type of processor that's deployed on the server where the software is installed.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on the physical device and its PVU license usage data.

The rule compares the license calculation results of PVU sub-capacity and full-capacity and uses the smaller value as the total number of consumed license points.

Formula:

Total number of consumed license points = min(PVU sub-capacity usage, PVU full-capacity usage)
RVU rule for IBM LMT solution
License metric Resource value unit (RVU)
Rule description

Calculate license consumption for ILMT-managed products based on the number of activated processor cores that are available to the product.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on the physical device and its RVU license usage data.

The rule compares the license calculation results of RVU sub-capacity and full-capacity and uses the smaller value as the total number of consumed license points.

Formula:

Total number of consumed license points = min(RVU sub-capacity usage, RVU full-capacity usage)

VMware

VMware products

Product Supported versions Supported editions License rule
VMware VirtualCenter 7.0 Standard VMware per-instance licensing
6.0, 6.5, 6.7 Standard

VMware vRealize Operations

 2019, 2018, 2017, 7.0, 6.0 Advanced, Enterprise, Standard VMware Portable License Unit (PLU)
VMware vSphere Suite 7.0, 6.7, 6.5, 6.0 Enterprise plus, Enterprise, Standard
  • VMware per-CPU licensing
  • VMware per-CPU licensing for vSphere 7

License rules for VMware products

VMware per-CPU licensing
License metric Per CPU
Rule description

Calculates license consumption for products licensed by CPUs per physical device.

Prerequisites:

For software that is installed on a virtual machine, the rule requires that the relationship between the virtual machine and the physical server is established in UCMDB. See the UCMDB documentation for details.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations on a physical device. The software products are installed in the physical OSE or the virtual OSEs hosted by that physical device.

The total number of consumed license points is equal to the number of physical processors on that device.

Formula:

Total number of consumed license points = count(physical processors on the device)
VMware per-CPU licensing for vSphere 7
License metric Per CPU
Rule description

Calculates license consumption for products licensed by CPUs (up to 32 cores) per physical device.

Prerequisites:

For software that is installed on a virtual machine, the rule requires that the relationship between the virtual machine and the physical server is established in UCMDB. See the UCMDB documentation for details.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations on a physical device. The software products are installed in the physical OSE or the virtual OSEs hosted by that physical device.

On each physical processor of the physical device, every 32 physical cores consume one license point. The total number of consumed license points is equal to the number of license points consumed by each physical processor multiplied by the number of processors. 

Formula:

Total number of consumed license points = round(core count per physical processor / 32) * count(physical processors on the device)
VMware Portable License Unit (PLU)
License metric Portable License Unit (PLU)
Rule description

Calculates license consumption for products deployed on on-premises vSphere CPUs.

Note: In SAM, one PLU allows usage of vRealize Suite to manage unlimited operating system instances (OSIs)/virtual machines (VMs) deployed on one on-premises vSphere CPU.

Prerequisites:

For software that is installed on a virtual machine, the rule requires that the relationship between the virtual machine and the physical server is established in UCMDB. See the UCMDB documentation for details.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on the vSphere installations and its managed ESX hosts.

The total number of consumed license points is equal to the number of physical processors in all managed ESX hosts.

Formula:

Total number of consumed license points = sum(count(physical processors on managed ESX host))
VMware per-instance licensing
License metric Per instance
Rule description

Calculates license consumption for products licensed by instances.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations and their related OSE (either a physical or virtual OSE).

Each software installation consumes one license point. The total number of consumed license points is equal to the number of software installations.

Formula:

Total number of consumed license points = count(installations in the OSE)

Oracle

Oracle LMS products

Currently, SAM's license rules can only calculate the license consumption of on-premises Oracle LMS instances.

Product Supported versions Supported editions License rule
Oracle Database 19c, 18c, 12c, 11g, 10g Enterprise Licensing for Oracle Database Enterprise Edition with Processor metric
11g, 10g Standard, SE1 Licensing for Oracle Database Standard Edition with Processor metric
12c Standard, SE1, SE2 Licensing for Oracle Database Standard Edition with Processor metric
19c, 18c SE2 Licensing for Oracle Database Standard Edition with Processor metric

   Licensing for Oracle Database Enterprise Edition with Processor metric

License rules for Oracle LMS products

Licensing for Oracle Database Enterprise Edition with Processor metric
License metric Database – Processor
Rule description
  • Calculates license consumption for Oracle products of Enterprise Edition under the Processor licensing model.

  • Supports Oracle Database Enterprise Edition, Oracle Database options, and Oracle management packs.

Notes:

  • Oracle Database license consumption is calculated based on running instances instead of installed software.
  • This rule doesn't support scenarios where Oracle products are deployed on a public cloud.

Prerequisites:

For software that is installed on a virtual machine, the rule requires that the relationship between the virtual machine and the physical server is established in UCMDB. See the UCMDB documentation for details.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations on a physical device. The software products are installed in the physical OSE or the virtual OSEs hosted by that physical device.

This rule calculates license consumption differently for the following scenarios: 

  • Installations exist in the physical OSE
    1. Count the total number of physical cores in the physical OSE.
    2. Multiply the number of physical cores by the appropriate core factor to determine the total number of consumed license points. Note that the core factor used depends on the processor type deployed. For more information, see https://www.oracle.com/us/solutions/midsize/processor-core-factor-table-070634.pdf.
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    1. Determine the number of used cores for each virtual OSE.
      • If the virtual OSE is built via hard-partitioning technologies, find its maximum number of used physical cores. For more information about hard-partitioning, see https://www.oracle.com/assets/partitioning-070609.pdf.
      • If the virtual OSE isn't built via hard-partitioning technologies, use the number of physical cores on the physical device as the number of used cores in this virtual OSE.
    2. Get the sum of used physical cores for all virtual OSEs as the total number of cores to be licensed. Then, compare this number with the number of physical cores in the physical OSE, and use the smaller value for the next-step calculation.
    3. Multiply the number of cores in the preceding step by the appropriate core factor to determine the total number of consumed license points. Note that the core factor used depends on the processor type deployed. For more information, see https://www.oracle.com/us/solutions/midsize/processor-core-factor-table-070634.pdf.

Formula:

  • Installations exist in the physical OSE
    total number of consumed license points = round(count(physical cores on the device) * core factor)
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    total number of consumed license points = round(min(count(physical cores on the device), sum(count(physical cores used by virtual OSE))) * core factor)
Licensing for Oracle Database Standard Edition with Processor metric
License metric Database – Processor
Rule description
  • Calculates license consumption for Oracle products of Standard Edition under the Processor licensing model.

  • Supports Oracle Database Standard, SE1, and SE2.

Notes:

  • Oracle Database license consumption is calculated based on running instances instead of installed software.
  • This rule doesn't support scenarios where Oracle products are deployed on a public cloud.

Prerequisites:

For software that is installed on a virtual machine, the rule requires that the relationship between the virtual machine and the physical server is established in UCMDB. See the UCMDB documentation for details.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations on a physical device. The software products are installed in the physical OSE or the virtual OSEs hosted by that physical device.

This rule calculates license consumption differently for the following scenarios: 

  • Installations exist in the physical OSE
    The total number of consumed license points is equal to the number of physical processors in the physical OSE.
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    1. Get the sum of the maximum number of used virtual cores for all virtual OSEs as the total number of cores to be licensed.
    2. Divide the sum of virtual cores by the number of cores on each processor to get the number of physical processors to be licensed.
    3. Compare the number of physical processors to be licensed with the number of physical processors in the physical OSE, and use the smaller value as the total number of consumed license points. 

Formula:

  • Installations exist in the physical OSE
    total number of consumed license points = count(physical processors on the device)
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    total number of consumed license points = min(count(physical processors on the device), round(sum(count(maximum used virtual cores in virtual OSE)) / cores per physical processor))

License rules for Adobe CC products

Adobe user-based licensing
License metric Named user
Rule description

Calculates license consumption for Adobe products.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on the software installations and their related OSEs (either physical or virtual OSEs) owned by a user.

For a given user, the total number of consumed license points is always 1 regardless of how many software installations the user owns.

Formula:

total number of consumed license points = 1

Red Hat

Red Hat on-premises products

Product Supported versions License rule
Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server 7, 8, 9 Licensing for Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server (RHEL Server)
Server 7, 8, 9 Licensing for Red Hat Enterprise Linux for Virtual Datacenters (RHEL for Virtual Datacenter)

License rules for Red Hat products

Licensing for Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server (RHEL Server)
License metric Per Socket-pair (Server) 
Rule description
  • Calculates RHEL product consumption based on the number of socket-pairs or VM pairs on the physical hosts.
  • Supports RHEL Server 7, 8, and 9 

Prerequisites:

For software that is installed on a virtual machine, the rule requires that the relationship between the virtual machine and the physical server is established in UCMDB. See the UCMDB documentation for details.

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations on a physical device. The software products are installed in the physical OSE or the virtual OSEs hosted by that physical device.

The license consumption calculation of this rule contains two parts:

  • Installations exist in the physical OSE
    Every two physical processors consume one license point. Then, the total number of consumed license points is equal to the number of physical processors on that device divided by two.
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    Every two virtual OSEs consume one license point. Then, get the sum of consumed license points for all virtual OSEs

After that, the total number of consumed license points can be calculated by summing up the consumed license points of the above two parts.

Formula:

  • Installations exist in the physical OSE
    number of consumed license points = round(count(physical processors on the device) / 2)
  • Installations exist in virtual OSEs
    number of consumed license points = round(count(virtual OSEs) / 2)
  • Total number of consumed license points = round(count(physical processors on the device) / 2) + round(count(virtual OSEs) / 2)
 
Licensing for Red Hat Enterprise Linux for Virtual Datacenters (RHEL for Virtual Datacenter)
License metric Per Socket-pair (VDC)
Rule description
  • Calculates RHEL product consumption for the virtual environment and supports unlimited VMs on the hosts.

  • Supports RHEL Server 7, 8, and 9 

Algorithm:

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations on a physical device. The software products are installed in the virtual OSEs hosted by that physical device.

This rule calculates license consumption for the installations that exist in virtual OSEs with the Unlimited virtualization option:

Every two physical processors consume one license point. Then, the total number of consumed license points is equal to the number of physical processors on that device divided by two.

Formula:

Total number of consumed license points = round(count(physical processors on the device) / 2)

Broadcom per-device rule

This rule accepts a parameter that contains information on software installations and their related OSE (either a physical or virtual OSE).

The total number of consumed license points is always 1.

Formula:

Total number of consumed license points = 1
